intro: Brachyachyris, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their compact growth habit and showy, daisy-like flowers composed of ray and disk florets. Native to regions of southern Africa, Brachyachyris species typically thrive in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. They possess hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. The genus is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral displays.
